Home → Recommendations & reviews → Young Adult

Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

Mind Games by Teri Terry

Written by Amélie Magotte · Published Oct 24, 2017

Mind Games is an incredible, extremely enthralling book.

Celebrate Halloween with some of our favourite scary titles

Written by Sophie Green · Published Oct 24, 2017

Prepare for the scariest night of the year with our pick of the most thrilling supernatural titles.

Windfall by Jennifer E. Smith

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Oct 19, 2017

Windfall is an enjoyable book featuring likeable, interesting characters.

The Accident Season by Moïra Fowley-Doyle

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Oct 17, 2017

The Accident Season is a darkly beautiful tale with an ethereal, magical tone, strong narrative and twists that leave you breathless.

The Lines We Cross by Randa Abdel-Fattah

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Oct 10, 2017

The Lines We Cross is a brilliantly written, thought-provoking novel that will stay with you long after the final page.

One of Us is Lying by Karen M. McManus

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Oct 3, 2017

Prepare to get sucked into a tangled web of secrets, lies and betrayal in this gripping debut novel.

New Young Adult books for October 2017

Written by Sophie Green · Published Sep 28, 2017

New titles from Philip Pullman, John Green, Holly Bourne and more

Longbow Girl by Linda Davies

Written by Amélie Magotte · Published Sep 26, 2017

Longbow Girl is full to the brim with action, a messy romance, adventure and history.

The Names They Gave Us by Emery Lord

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Sep 21, 2017

The Names They Gave Us is a classic summer romance packed full of love, heartache, friends and family from an author to watch.

The Reluctant Journal of Henry K. Larsen by Susin Nielsen

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Sep 19, 2017

The Reluctant Journal of Henry K. Larsen is a great book for anyone experiencing tragedy and what it feels like for those left behind.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
